title.rendered: Valley of Flowers Trek Tour Package

content.rendered:
Valley of Flowers Trek Tour Package

Home » India » Uttarakhand » Valley of Flowers Trek Tour Package

Tour Overview

Valley of flowers is a situated in Bhyundar Valley at an elevation of 3250 Mts above sea level. The valley of flowers was declared as the National Park of India in the year 1982 and it is now a world heritage site. The virgin beauty of this mystical valley has always lured botanists, nature lovers and adventure lovers. Many a legend is associated with this vibrant and eye-catching Valley and is often in the epics of the Ramayana and Mahabharata. Best time to visit valley of flowers from mid-July to mid-August because the bloom starts immediately after the melting of snow.

You can reach the valley of flowers from Haridwar to Joshimath then Govindghat and trek to Ghangaria. It is the last place where you can find hotels, lodges, etc. Govindghat is the point from where the trek is started. Ghangaria is situated at a height of 10,500 feet. The charming beauty of the place is increased more with the long deodar trees. The cold is enough. Hemkund is 06 Km on the left bridle path from Ghangaria. Hemkund is surrounding the place are 07 snow-clad peaks of lofty mountains. The beautiful lake of clear and sweet water is full of lotus flowers in the center and the sweet blooming variety of grassy fields all around the lake, despite an unrivaled sublime beauty of magnificent grandeur.

Valley of Flowers Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Haridwar – Joshimath

On arrival Haridwar greeting from our representative & transfer to Joshimath. Overnight stay at Joshimath.

Day 2 :Joshimath – Govindghat – Ghangaria/14 Km Trek

Morning transfer to Govindghat from there trekking would be started, it is a 14 Km Trek route you can hire pony also. Overnight stay at Ghangaria.

Day 3 :Ghangaria – Valley of Flower/05 Km Trek

Wake up with fresh nature and trek to valley of flowers. Get ready to catch memorable pictures on your cameras. Come back Ghangaria. Overnight stay at Ghangaria.

Day 4 :Ghangaria – Hemkund Sahib/06 Km Trek

Morning trek to Holy Hemkund Sahib Ji, take the blessing and come back Ghangaria. Overnight stay at Ghangaria.

Day 5 :Ghangaria – Joshimath

Morning back to Govindghat, transfer to Joshimath. Evening free to explore the Joshimath. Overnight stay at Joshimath.

Day 6 :Joshimath – Haridwar

Morning transfer to Haridwar. Tour end with happy memories…

Price Details

Tour Name Valley of Flowers Trek
Duration 6 Days / 5 Nights
Destinations Haridwar - Joshimath - Valley of flowers
Tour Price On Request

    Trip Highlights

    • Exciting trekking at Govind Ghat
    • Be at the mesmerizing Valley Of Flowers at Ghangaria
    • Hemkund Sahib Visit
    • City tour at Joshimath

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Valley of Flowers Tour Package

    Q. When Is The Best Time To Visit The Valley Of Flowers?

    A. Valley of Flowers is a high-altitude tourist destination open only from June to October. As a result, visiting VOF during these four months is the best option. Heavy rainfall is common in the Valley of Flowers area due to its high altitude; therefore, we recommend that you check the weather conditions before beginning your trek to Valley of Flowers.

    Q. Is It Possible To Visit The Valley Of Flowers Without Trekking?

    A. The Valley of Flowers trek does not require a trekking guide. The trek route is well-marked, and hundreds of people and mules are following it. If you are traveling alone and require assistance in an emergency, it is best to hire a guide.

    Q. What Distinguishes The Valley Of Flowers?

    A. The valley is home to a variety of rare and amazing wildlife species, including the grey langur, flying squirrel, Himalayan weasel, and black bear, as well as the red fox, lime butterfly, snow leopard, and Himalayan Monal, to name a few.

    Q. How Long Will The Valley Of Flowers Be Open To The Public?

    A. Every year on June 1st, the Valley of Flowers trek is open to the public. From June to October, the park is open for business. Start early from Ghangaria to give yourself more time in the Valley of Flowers.

    Q. How Many Different Kinds Of Flowers Can You Find In The Valley Of Flowers?

    A. The Valley of Flowers is home to 520 high altitude plant species, including angiosperms, gymnosperms, and Pteridophytes, 498 of which are flowering plants.
